title: Commerce Clause - Document #e4d65047
content:
UNITED STATES CODE
Title 43 - Commerce Clause

Chapter 4 - COMMERCE CLAUSE

§ 3522. Commerce Clause provisions

(a) GENERAL RULE.—The provisions of this section shall apply to all matters involving commerce clause under federal jurisdiction.

(b) DEFINITIONS.—In this section:
    (1) The term "commerce clause" means the legal framework, procedures, and standards established for commerce clause under federal law.
    (2) The term "federal jurisdiction" means the authority exercised by federal courts and agencies.

(c) REQUIREMENTS.—
    (1) All covered entities must comply with federal standards for commerce clause.
    (2) Compliance includes adherence to procedural requirements and substantive standards.
    (3) Documentation and reporting requirements must be satisfied as specified.

(d) ENFORCEMENT.—
    The Attorney General may bring enforcement actions for violations of commerce clause requirements. Civil penalties and injunctive relief are available remedies.

(e) EFFECTIVE DATE.—This section shall take effect 102 days after the date of enactment.

(f) REGULATIONS.—The Secretary may prescribe regulations necessary to carry out this section.

Enacted: 2021-01-27
Public Law: 112-181
